claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling in tumors.

evidence.quote: Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: Type I interferon induction was demonstrated in murine models but may vary in human tumor microenvironments.

claims.claim: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase following mRNA vaccination.

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape
Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.

claims.caveat: Immunopeptidomics measurements were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases after mRNA vaccination, creating a rationale for checkpoint blockade combination.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x | 1.0x | Checkpoint axis became more targetable
PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: PD-L1 upregulation was observed in mouse models and may not translate equivalently to all human tumor types.

claims.claim: Combined mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 intervention improves tumor control in mice.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors due to species-specific immune differences.

claims.claim: Vaccinated patients show improved survival outcomes when receiving ICI treatment.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
Human retrospective metastatic cohort: 130 patients total.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely and causal inference is limited.

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is required for the mRNA vaccine-mediated sensitization effect.

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: IFNAR1 blockade experiments were conducted in mouse models; human interferon signaling pathways may have redundant components.
